key_title: Key to the species of Chloris

Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lemma of lower (fertile) floret tapered at apex, with a distinct tuft of cilia on the upper margin; spikes semi-erect to erect in flower
Lemma of lower (fertile) floret very obtuse to truncate, without a distinct tuft of cilia on the upper margin; spikes widely spreading in flower
Awn of spikelet about as long as spikelet or shorter
Awn of spikelet at least twice as long as spikelet
Lower floret subequal to upper glume, not strongly embracing the upper floret; widespread grass, particularly on basalt plains
Lower floret distinctly longer than upper glume, its lemma wrapping around the upper floret and almost entirely enclosing it; very rare grass of north-east and far east
